div.fw: ¶ Her͗e biginneth þe Prolog of þe Cokꝭes tale
div.l: Til deth departed þem þis life þei ledde
And fareth now well my tale is at a ende
Now iħuIhesu Crist that of his might mai sende
Ioy aftre wo gouerne vs in his grace
And kepe vs all that arn in þis place · Amen 
Here endeth þe man of lawes tale of Constance / And next
biginneth þe Prolog be fore the Cokys tale 
The Coke of londoıı̄un whiles þe ryve spak
For Ioly he þoȝt to haue claued him in þe bak
A ha qduod he · he hath seid for cristes passioıı̄un
This myller hath a sharper conclusioıı̄un
Vpon̄ his argument of his burgage
Wel seid Salamon̄ in his langage
Ne bring not eueri man to his house
For herburgage be night is ꝑperlouse
Well aught a man̄ avised for to be
Whom þat he brouȝt into his privite
I pray to god so yeue me care
Yif euer sithen I hight hogge of war͗e
div.note: Here and at line 22, the right marginal notation is in the red ink usual for annotations; the left marginal notes are black in "the scribe's informal hand" (Mosser).
div.l: Herd I never better a myller set of werk
He had a Iape of malice in þe derk
And þer͗efor if ye vouchesaue to her͗e ·
But god forbede that we stynten̄ her͗e line 15 added in right margin.
A tale of me þat am a pouer man̄
I wil you tell aswel as I can
A litul Iape þat folk in our͗e Cite
Oure oste seid I graunte it þe
Now tel on Roger loke it be goode
For many a pasty hast þou lete blode
And many a Iak of Dower hast þᵘou solde
Þat hath be twies hote ⁊and twies colde
Of many a pilgrine hast þou had cristes corse
For þi ꝑpersely þey ferne þe worse
Þat þey haue eten̄ with þe · þe stubbill goos
For in þi shopp is many a flye loos
Now gentel Roger͗e be þi name
But yit I prai þe be not wroth for game
Thou seist ful soft qduod Roger be my faithe
But soth pley is quad pley as þe flēmmyng saith
Be þou not wrothe or we deꝑparte her͗e
Though þat my tale be of a hosteler͗e
But neuer͗e þe lese I wil not tel it yit
But or we deꝑparte I will þe quyte
And þer͗ewith all þey lough and made cher͗e
